etymologies: late Middle English: via Old French and Latin from Greek mastikhē (perhaps from mastikhan ‘masticate’)

definitions: an aromatic gum or resin that exudes from the bark of a Mediterranean tree, used in making varnish and chewing gum and as a flavoring

examples.text: incense made from sandalwood, eagle-wood, mastic and cloves

shortDefinitions: aromatic gum or resin that exudes from bark of Mediterranean tree

definitions: the bushy evergreen Mediterranean tree of the cashew family that yields mastic and has aromatic leaves and fruit, closely related to the pistachio.
shortDefinitions: bushy evergreen Mediterranean tree which yields mastic and has aromatic leaves and fruit

definitions: a waterproof filler and sealant used in building

examples.text: run a bead of mastic along the gap
use a mastic between the joints
